attributes.action: Make single carriageway A-roads safer
attributes.background: Single carriageway roads are 7 times more dangerous than motorways. With a record Â£6m investment in our road network, the Government should legislate for physical barriers on single carriageway A-roads to prevent head on collisions, and for a reduction in the speed limit.
attributes.additional_details: Research by the Road Safety Foundation concluded that single carriageway roads are 7 times more dangerous than motorways. Having been involved in a high speed head on collision on a single carriageway A-road, a physical barrier in the middle of the road would prevent unscrupulous drivers from overtaking, thus eradicating the possibility of a head on collision. Moreover, a reduction in the speed limit from 60mph would also further improve road safety.

attributes.action: Allow Cannabis users to grow upto 5 plants without fear of prosecution
attributes.background: We are here to ask for the law to allow us users the ability to grow up to FIVE plants for personal use across the UK (Durham have already done this, as well as almost ALL of the USA with states by-passing the DEA to allow users access Washington State recently) from seed without taking cuttings!

attributes.action: Vets to be regulated by a independent governing body impartially from the RCVS
attributes.background:
Vets are not regulated by any real governing body at present, and can charge as much as they like, and go back on their word. 
They can give the wrong advise to a owner which can be costly and put a animal through unnecessary treatments.
It needs to be regulated like all other services.
attributes.additional_details:
A vet can offer a service but then change their mind at a later date, for example offering to put a animal to sleep for free as they animal had surgery on their advice which made the situation worse and the animal to suffer more, and then charge the owner at a later date. 
Vets also prey on owners whose animal is sick and put profit ahead of the animals well being, and the RCVS can do little to help.
They are not answerable to anything and this needs to change.

attributes.action: Encourage the EEA to pemit UK visa holders to travel freely in the Schengen area
attributes.background: As a resident in the UK with a valid UK visa, it seems unnecessary that a Schengen visa is required for tourism/business purposes in the Schengen area. Some form of long term visit visa with stringent background checks might be a good solution.
attributes.additional_details: I am an Indian citizen working as an Engineer in the UK. I enjoy travelling in my spare time and I also have the need to attend business meetings in the Schengen area. I have personally experienced the trouble of applying for short term visit visas (both Tourism and Business).  I encourage the the honourable UK govt. to urge the EU to look into a solution to this, by offering a longer term visa, with restrictions on the maximum number of days spent continuously in the EU. This solution could be offered to someone who has travelled to the EU at least twice, to prove that the country of interest is the UK.

attributes.action: To make sure every care home has CCTV  to protect the elderly
attributes.background: After my grandmother was treated appallingly by home care staff in her own home and in care homes.
attributes.additional_details:
The police have cameras attached to them and I think carers should have the same kind of thing to stop the abuse of elderly people.
My gran died from blood poisoning caused by bed sores after carers did not provide adequate care

attributes.action: Change the NHS 24 week revival rule
attributes.background: At the moment doctors are under no legal obligation to help any babies born before 24 weeks gestation, from what doctors have told me this is because they say babies don't have developed lungs until 24 weeks. However the earliest baby to survive was born at just 21 weeks.
attributes.additional_details: 3 years ago my son was born at just 20 weeks, he was born alive and fought for his life for 2 hours before taking his last breath. Doctors did nothing to help my baby because of the 24 week rule, and I'm sure there are hundreds of families in my situation. Like I said the earliest baby to survive was born at 21 weeks, the only reason the hospital helped her is because she lied about how far gone she was. The bottom line of a hospitals job is to keep people alive when they enter the hospital.

attributes.action: I want the mandatory tv licence in September to be abolished.
attributes.background: Come September 1 2016 you will be required by law to purchase a television licence, regardless of how you watch - this includes YouTube and BBC iPlayer etc.
attributes.additional_details:
From the TV licence website - 

No matter what device you use, you must be covered by a TV Licence if you watch or record live TV. This includes:
TV sets
Laptops and desktop computers
Tablets, mobile phones, satnavs and other portable devices
Digital boxes (PVRs), satellite and cable, e.g. Freeview, Freesat, Sky, Virgin Media, BT Vision, YouView, Apple TV, Chromecast, Roku and Amazon Fire TV
Games consoles
DVD, Blu-ray and VHS recorders

http://www.tvlicensing.co.uk/check-if-you-need-one

attributes.action: Allow CCW in the UK for self defence
attributes.background: With violent crime at a whole time high in the UK.   And with the major threat of another terror attack,  it is a human right to be able to defend ourselves against this situation.  It is time for the right to CCW. (Conceal carry )   gun ownership for self defense can work in the UK.  Safely
attributes.additional_details: People always say the uk doesn't want to decommissioning another America when it comes to guns,  the media only report the criminal aspect of guns, they never report on the lives saved by the gun,  the crime stopped by the gun,   guns were banned after the Dunblane killings, but think.  If the kids were killed by a kitchen knife. Would the government have banned all kitchen knives, no..  gun ownership can work for self defense in the UK.  It is YOUR  human right to be able to protect yourself

attributes.action: Call for Turkey's removal from NATO
attributes.background:
The North Atlantic Council, should formally oust Turkey from NATO for good before its belligerence and continual aggression drags the international community into World War III.
Under Erdogan, our NATO ally has arrested more journalists than China, jailed thousands for the crime of free speech.
attributes.additional_details: Erdogan publicly flaunted his support for Hamas & ISIS while accusing Israel of crimes against humanity, violated an arms ban to Gaza, bought an air defense system from the Chinese in defiance of NATO, and denied America the use of its own air base to conduct strikes during the Iraqi War & ISIS in Syria. Turkey has been tacitly fueling the ISIS war machine. There is evidence to show that Turkey has allowed jihadists from around the world to swarm into Syria by crossing through Turkeyâs territory

attributes.action: Make horse riders pick up their horses excrement! Or slap them with a fine!
attributes.background: Why should horse riders get away with leaving massive piles of dump in the middle of the road and down our streets, when dog owners get slapped with a massive fine for a little dump! All pets should be treated with the same rules! No excuses!

attributes.action: Fertility treatment, artificial insemination and IVF free for lesbian couples
attributes.background: It is wrong to make gay couples pay to start a family. It costs around Â£1500 per try and not every gay couple can afford this. Lesbians and gay couples should be provided with free fertility treatment. They want to start a family but cannot afford this. They should not be punished for being gay.

attributes.action: Driving - Impose a compulsory ability re-test every 10 years for all UK drivers.
attributes.background: I propose that all drivers should be given an ability re-test every 10 years from the date of driving test pass. This is not a full test the same as the first driving test but an ability test to ensure all drivers are safe, aware, knowledgeable enough to handle the UK's roads safely.
attributes.additional_details:
In industry it is normal practice and a lawful H&S requirement to retest workers for various different skills (i.e. first aid, electrical safety, handling of heavy machinery) so why does this not apply to drivers? This will ensure only competent and safe drivers take to the roads. It will weed out those individuals who are no longer capable of driving a vehicle for whatever reason.
Those convicted of a serious motoring offence should also be ordered to take the test to re-gain their licence.

attributes.action: To prevent women from serving in frontline infantry units
attributes.background: In order to prevent a drop in morale among male ranks currently serving in frontline units.

attributes.action: Guarantee that EU nationals legally settled here before the Referendum can stay.
attributes.background: We should honour our responsibility to treat fairly our friends and colleagues from other EU countries, who were legally settled in the UK before the June 23rd Referendum.

attributes.action: Call on the Saudi Arabian leaders to decriminalise homosexuality
attributes.background: In Saudi Arabia, same-sex sexual activity is punishable by floggings, life imprisonment, chemical castration, whipping torture and even the death penalty. People convicted twice are executed. Please call on the Saudi Arabian government to end the suffering of homosexuals in Saudi Arabia.

attributes.action: No sex Education in Primary School
attributes.background: Kids  never forgets these videos they watched from school and they come to INTERNET and watch them again and again
attributes.additional_details: Because it's completely inappropriate to the kids in Primary schools..

attributes.action: Both parents should have to sign off on the important decisions in a childs life
attributes.background: 8 and half week ago my sons dad decided he was keeping our son and not bringing him home.  I haven't seen or spoke to our son since. His dad was able to change his school and gp without my permission. I want the law to change so that both parents have to agree to important changes in a child's life
attributes.additional_details: Im having to fight tooth and nail just to speak to my son.  My heart is in pieces and i want to make sure no one else has to go through what im currently experiencing. Schools, doctors, passports etc should all have to require both parents signatures,  not just one parent.

attributes.action: Referendum to choose between negotiated IN and OUT EU plans
attributes.background: On 23rd June the British Electorate was given a choice between remaining in the EU or something else. We did not know what that alternative was. We should give the people of the UK a proper choice between two concrete negotiated plans for our future either in or out of the EU before leaving.

attributes.action: Call for an early election with support for proportional representation.
attributes.background: At a time where the country is in need of leadership, our representation has failed a public of diverse views. Reform is urgently needed to support a liberal democracy, with proportional representation; where ministers are elected based on their qualifications to represent a sector; all views count.
attributes.additional_details:
The lead up to the EU Referendum in the UK has exposed our leaders as being at odds with the public they are meant to serve. A vote of no confidence is required, not just in the party leaders and our Prime Minister, but also in the way the public are represented, and the way in which decisions are made on public services.

We, the undersigned, call for an early election - within the year; with reform for proportional representation and the right to elect ministers based on their qualifications.

attributes.action: At least 40% of those eligible to vote in a referendum must support change.
attributes.background: The Trade Union Act 2016 requires that at least 40% of those eligible to vote must back action for strikes in core public services. This is to limit disruption caused by an unrepresentative result. The same logic and rules should apply to a referendum, especially on important constitutional areas.

attributes.action: Call a referendum on the UK joining the European Free Trade Association (EFTA)
attributes.background: EFTA is a free trade area and currently includes Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, and Switzerland. It operates in parallel with the EU, and all its member states participate in the EU's single market. Norway rejected membership of the EU in national referendums in 1973 and 1995, but stayed in EFTA.

attributes.action: Free University Education for English students now that we are leaving the EU.
attributes.background:
For too long we English students have been forced into paying ridiculous tuition fees for university. The Scottish, Welsh and EU students have their education free while we study almost drowning in debt. 

We have now voted to LEAVE the EU and hence can control how we pay for our education.
attributes.additional_details: The EU students can now be classed as international students making them pay for their education and with the surge of money, which supposedly isn't being spent on the EU membership fees, we english students should receive a free higher education.

attributes.action: Create an independent state in Exeter, Devon and apply to join the EU.
attributes.background: Exeter people voted over 55% to remain in the EU.  Exeter is a thriving aspirational city with a very bright future has an expanding population.  Exeter has a bright future within EU, a distinctive culture and a world renowned food and produce heritage as well as a magnet for international business.

attributes.action: Let us know the economic plan for departing the European Union. Immediately.
attributes.background: An economic plan for leaving the European Union was vague during the leave campaign. In the 24 hours post-brexit we have seen the decline of the GBP, businesses announcing they're leaving and the USA saying the UK goes to the back of the queue for a trade deal. We need to know what the plan is, now.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/06/23/eu-referendum-what-the-world-is-saying---britains-historic-decis/ 

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36611512

attributes.action: Guarantee a minimum extra Â£100m per week invested into the NHS.
attributes.background:
'Vote Leave' have successfully won the EU Referendum and we can expect the UK to start proceedings to withdraw from Europe. 

'Vote Leave' campaigned with assurances that the money we are currently handing over to the EU could be better spent on our own public services.
attributes.additional_details:
Now that 'Leave' have won this referendum they need to live up to the promises made during the campaign and guarantee that this money will be spent on public services that greatly need extra support. 

"Let's give our NHS the Â£350 million the EU takes every week" was a specific slogan of the 'Leave' campaign. The 'Leave' campaign website also stated "Vote Leave to invest an extra Â£100m into the NHS every week".

These were explicit statements made during the campaign and many people have voted on the back of such promises made. The government needs to ensure that any negotiations out of the EU also includes assurances that funds currently paid to the EU be reinvested into our public services and specifically into our underfunded NHS.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on independence for London
attributes.background: Unlike the rest of the UK, London is predominantly Labour and the whole of London voted to remain in the EU. We are no longer philosophically in step with the rest of the UK. We suggest that London be afforded the opportunity to declare independence, or become part of Scotland, in a referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
London: housing crisis, Muslim Labour mayor, diverse and younger population, voted remain unanimously
Rest of UK: predominantly Conservative, voted for leaving the EU, affordable housing still exists

attributes.action: Force County Councils to allow residents to use their closest recycling center
attributes.background: Many County Councils require proof of residency before allowing them to use their recycling centers. This forces people to travel extra distances to avoid crossing county borders to recycle. It is bad for the environment and councils should be forced to co-operate to limit this environmental damage.
attributes.additional_details: Residents of Sandhurst could travel a 6.6 mile round journey and use the Camberley recycling center. Surrey County Council are now not allowing cross county border use and as a result these residents are having to travel a 13.6 mile round journey to the Bracknell recycling center. This causes extra environmental damage and increased road use. This type of policy is in force in many areas of the country and should not be acceptable as a simple agreement between councils could stop this lunacy.

attributes.action: Send all foreign prisoners back to their countries of origin and ban them.
attributes.background: We have seen on recent BBC news programmes that the UK prison service is in a dire straight. Lack of funding, violent and dangerous it is another failing part of the UK.  Foreign criminals, many from the EU now make up a significant part of the UK inmates and are costing us a fortune.

attributes.action: Postpone the EU referendum until David Cameron has negotiated an exit agreement.
attributes.background: It seems to be an unfair situation for the public to make such an important decision without truly knowing what an exit would cost. A strong leader should have negotiated terms for both staying in the EU and leaving. We will then be able to calculate the true cost of leaving or staying in the union.
attributes.additional_details: David Cameron spent only a short time negotiating with Europe about staying in the union. Another period of the same length should be spent negotiating terms for leaving the union. This might work in favour of the UK. Businesses would research all avenues for the best solution for them, this would help them make informed financial decisions. Recently the Conservative's published that Â£1 paid to the EU Equals Â£10 recieved. Maybe Â£0 paid will return Â£9, Nobody knows. Let's negotiate and find out.

attributes.action: Ban the Union Jack on labels and advertising on products not made in the UK
attributes.background: Customers should be able to make their choice of goods based on where products are substantially made. Whether it's sausages, clothes or electrical goods we need to have this information. Advertisers should not be able to put a Union Jack on goods that are not substantially British!

attributes.action: Repeal the Act of Settlement (1700) and the Accession Declaration Act 1910.
attributes.background: The two acts that this petition demands to be revoked enforce religious discrimination in the succession to the monarchy; they require the monarch to be in communion with the Church of England.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition demands that the two acts mentioned in the title and the following links are repealed.

The Act of Settlement (1700) - http://www.legislation.gov.uk/aep/Will3/12-13/2/contents

The Accession Declaration Act 1910 - http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/Edw7and1Geo5/10/29/contents

attributes.action: Require ingredients to be listed on the packaging of all alcoholic drinks.
attributes.background: Soft drinks, rightly, have to list ingredients. We should also know what goes into the beer, wine and spirits that we consume.  Consumers will be able to make better decisions about what they drink if they know that preservatives,  flavourings or potential allergens are present.

attributes.action: Establish a publicly owned and possibly funded film production company.
attributes.background: For 70 years The British film industry has been dominated by the American industry there are two known reason for this fact. The first being that the Americans have the advantage on distribution side  and the second being that they know theyâll receive British funding through tax relief breaks.
attributes.additional_details:
the solution is to establish a national production company which would by run by elective committee of British film makers with the purpose of producing Public service feature length films.

references

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-34013145

http://www.theguardian.com/film/2015/feb/03/record-revenues-for-films-made-in-uk

http://screenrant.com/british-film-industry-hollywood/

attributes.action: Change Road tax back to engine size not emissions
attributes.background: The government changed Road tax to emissions based so those wealthy enough to afford new virtual emission free cars pay no Road tax but still 4 wheels wearing Road causeing potholes electric cars no Road tax paid

attributes.action: Strip police officers who have falsified statements, of their Police Pension.
attributes.background: We petition the Government to strip police officers found to have falsified statements following and relating to the Hillsborough Disaster of 15 April 1989 of their Police Pension. It is disgraceful that in the years since lies have been perpetuated. Change the law, enabling stripping of pensions.

attributes.action: Ban diesel fuel! We deserve cleaner air.
attributes.background: Diesel fuel is slowly killing us. Let's get rid of it and live healthier, longer lives.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.theguardian.com/business/2016/apr/21/all-top-selling-cars-break-emissions-limits-in-real-world-tests

attributes.action: Ban smoking outside pubs,restaurants and cafes to make a smoke-free Britain
attributes.background: We need to ban this because when people like to sit outside a restaurant in the summer if they do not smoke they do not want anyone smoking outside when they are eating the food.
attributes.additional_details: when you are just coming  in the a pub you do not want people outside smoking when you come you mind not want to go in the pub at the end.

attributes.action: Scrap the 15 year limit for voting rights of British citizens living abroad
attributes.background: British citizens who have lived abroad for 15 years are not allowed to vote at British elections. British citizens who live abroad in the EU will be the most effected by the results of the British referendum in June 2016. All of them must be allowed to participate in the referendum!!!
attributes.additional_details: British citizens who live abroad are also not allowed to vote in the country where they live because they do not have the citizenship in that country. They pay taxes and cannot vote in any country - this unfairness has to stop!!! The 15 year rule makes no sense in the modern world of telecommunication and with globally accessible media.

attributes.action: Legislate for homeopathic medicines to be tested to provide proof of efficacy.
attributes.background: Under current legislation it is permissible for the manufacturers of homeopathic medicines to sell their products and have them prescribed on the NHS without any proof that they are an effective remedy for any ailment. This has the potential to defraud the purchaser.
attributes.additional_details: Government guidance on the registration of homeopathic medicines. https://www.gov.uk/guidance/register-a-homeopathic-medicine-or-remedy

attributes.action: Prevent women from fighting in close combat roles in the British Armed Forces.
attributes.background:
- If a woman wants to serve on the frontline, they need to meet the same physical criteria as men, otherwise lives will be put at risk.
- It would cause discontent among serving members of the armed forces, with many threatening to leave if this becomes policy.
attributes.additional_details:
- Women should not qualify for combat roles with lower physical capabilities, for example they might have to carry a heavy male, with full armour to save his life.

- It would cloud judgement of male counterparts, who would instinctively choose to save a woman if two people's lives were in danger, despite not always being the right decision to take.

- Women, in the main, cannot carry 110lb on their back (as soldiers in Afghanistan did).

- There are already many combat roles open to women.

attributes.action: Ban UKPC from being able to recieve driver information from the DVLA.
attributes.background: On Mon 11/1/16 the BBC will air a broadcast about UKPC within their Inside Out West Midlands at 19:30 GMT. This will be avaliable on the BBC iPlayer afterwards also. UKPC have been found on the 9/15 to be in vialation and given sanction points. Now they have been found out again. Action is needed.
attributes.additional_details:
BBC Inside Out West Midlands is on Monday 11 January on BBC One at 19:30 GMT and available afterwards on iPlayer.

http://forums.moneysavingexpert.com/showthread.php?t=4766249

attributes.action: increase penalties for leaving the scene of an accident in a motor vehicle
attributes.background: I wish to increase the penalties emposed to drivers if found leaving the scene of an accident. I feel dissapointed that police do not enforce sufficient penalties for people who leave someone or something for dead at sides of roads after hitting them. same applies to accidents with vehicles
attributes.additional_details: Spring hill road - accrington - DOG Killed by speeding driver who made off, leaving owner at side of road in a state with no way of knowing who killed her dog. police was informed and she was told without a number plate we cant help.

attributes.action: Tackle the pay gap between men and women.
attributes.background:
According to AAUW, the pay gap wonât close until 2152 - lets change that.
Why should women be paid 20% less than a man doing exactly the same job?
Please sign this petition and help us take one more step towards gender equality.

attributes.action: Require transport authorities to fund free concessionary fares for unpaid carers
attributes.background: Unpaid Carers (carers who do not provide care as a career) are a crucial part of society saving the government Â£162 billion every year. Travel is an essential service and yet, is a barrier that makes it harder for us to deal with our many responsibilities.
attributes.additional_details: Public transport is a service that is a need, we are an essential part of the community so why can't we use it too! Not everyone can get benefits so let's help carers get what they deserve, it may not seem important to most but to many it will change their lives. We deserve to be treated as equals...Is free/concessionary transport for carers to much to ask for in return for those who dedicate their lives to care for others?

attributes.action: Build new and expand, grammar schools in England to provide quality education.
attributes.background: Recently Warwickshire council eleven plus exam was held. There were a couple of thousands of pupils who sat for the exam. But there are only about 300 to 400 places in the grammar schools in Warwickshire.  Please allow more and do not ban outright on the grounds of social mobility.
attributes.additional_details: The parents who want their child to study in grammar schools need to go through lot of struggles now.  House prices in grammar school catchment area is very high. As the population grows, demand for grammar schools among low and middle class families increased many folds. Allowing more grammar schools would only provide more choices to the parents and help social mobility. A blanket ban would cause more pressure to many hard working parents who wants to provide quality education.

attributes.action: Create more awareness and help for Children affected and bereaved by Suicide.
attributes.background: Suicide is often a joke among people, this may affect one of the survivors of 4400 suicide attempts taken place per year. More should be done to raise empathy and support for bereaved/affected children in schools. Also there is a lack of widespread support available, e.g. specialised therapists.

attributes.action: Impose stiffer penalties for hand held mobile phone use in vehicles.
attributes.background:
Use of such phones is not diminishing . Evidence from police force videos shows drivers talking and texting or viewing smartphone content. 
Phone logs time stamp usage
Current penalties are not fit for purpose. 
The consequences of accidents caused by such drivers are totally unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
A Zero Tolerance deterrent is urgently needed to make the results of a conviction more meaningful to the driver and on a par with the offence of drink-driving.  

- An immediate suspension of the driving licence upon apprehension

- On conviction, automatic 12 month disqualification, 6 points on the    licence and Â£1000 fine, plus seizure of the mobile device.

- If convicted a second time, the courts should be allowed to impose unlimited disqualification, fine or even imprisonment.

attributes.action: Introduction of a 1% Health and Care tax as soon as possible.
attributes.background: Population needs are rising beyond the levels that can be met by current treasury allocations to social care and to the NHS. The five year political cycle and the impact of austerity places vital services at significant risk from fluctuating investment and reorganisations.
attributes.additional_details: A new tax could provide some certainty while politicians consider all options for the future which should include an independent commission.

attributes.action: Abolish assured shorthold tenancies
attributes.background: Assured shorthold tenancies provide no security whatsoever for those in private rented accommodation. With tenancies being restricted to as little as six months, hard working families find themselves not knowing where or even if they are going to have a roof over their head in the immediate future.

attributes.action: Bring the child victims of the Syrian conflict to the UK and Europe.
attributes.background: Every day for the past five years a child has lost its life due to the conflict. The world has stood by for way to long and watched children pay the price for adult wars! it is my belief we have a OBLIGATION to rescue and protect as many of these children as we can.
attributes.additional_details: It is only since the outrage over Aylan Kurdi and now Omran Daqneesh the world has woken up and realized what the Syrian people have been dealing with as daily life for five whole years. It is in my belief we should ALL be doing what we can to evacuate these children and home them in safe countries. They do not deserve to pay the price for adult wars and this MUST be stopped! There must be relief provided and as many children evacuated as possible. Thank you all for your support.
